River Valley Primary School is a government, co-educational school. The school's ALP, "Comms-IT Rt!", focuses on developing communication skills through technology. Its LLP, "Every RVian a Leader", is dedicated to nurturing student leadership and community service, reflecting its focus on developing well-rounded citizens.

Riverside Primary School believes "every child possesses unique potential waiting to be discovered and nurtured". The school builds a strong foundation for life for its students ("Riverians") through a holistic, balanced, and creatively delivered curriculum. Its core SPARKLE values guide its programmes and ethos.

Rivervale Primary School's vision is "The Rivervale - School of Excellence, Individuals of Character". The school's mission is to inspire and develop "Riverlites" to be Caring, Adaptable and Confident. The school's core values include Respect, Responsibility, Resilience, Integrity, Care, Harmony, Excellence, and Teamwork.

Rosyth School, established in 1956, is one of the two original primary schools selected to host the Gifted Education Programme (GEP) in 1984. The school has a strong emphasis on values inculcation and aims for its students ("Rosythians") to become global citizens. Its ALP is focused on Augmenting Science Learning through Innovation.

Rulang Primary School was originally founded in 1930 as Joo Long Public School. The school's current name is the Hanyu Pinyin of its original name. Rulang has achieved numerous national awards, including the School Excellence Award, and continues to be known for its commitment to holistic development and academic accomplishment.

Sembawang Primary School's mission is to develop "Innovative Learners, Rooted in Values". The school is a single-session government school that focuses on character, leadership, and positive change. It utilizes innovative methods, including metacognitive strategies and AI technology (like ChatGPT), to enhance its Mother Tongue Language program.

Sengkang Green Primary School's crest, inspired by the resilient Tembusu tree, symbolizes a growing child anchored in strong values, thriving in a fast-changing world. The school provides an all-round education by balancing the development of character and abilities. Its ALP focuses on future skills through experiential project work, complementing its LLP in the arts.

Seng Kang Primary School's vision is "Every Seng Kang Primary student an Inventive Thinker, a Confident Leader and a Gracious Citizen". Its mission is "Nurturing self-directed learners with inquiring minds, anchored on moral values to lead, care and serve". The school's core values are Graciousness, Integrity, Confidence, and Resilience.

Shuqun Primary School's vision is "A vibrant learning community, rooted in values with a heart to serve". The school's ICARE values (Integrity, Care, Adaptability, Respect, Excellence) are central to its ethos. The school provides a student-centric and values-driven education, aiming to develop well-rounded students with strong character and leadership qualities.

Si Ling Primary School is a government, co-educational school that fosters an environment where "learning comes alive". The school's curriculum and signature programmes are geared towards nurturing a caring and learning community. It offers support for students with Special Educational Needs and promotes community and student leadership as its Learning for Life Programme.

Singapore Chinese Girls' School (Primary) is affiliated with its secondary section and is committed to providing a holistic and balanced education founded on timeless values and rich heritage. It is guided by Renzulli's Schoolwide Enrichment Model to help students discover and hone their talents in academics, arts, sports, and technology.

South View Primary School is a popular government, co-educational school in Choa Chu Kang, with a high application rate. The school is recognized for its rigorous academic curriculum complemented by vibrant co-curricular activities. It offers a range of special programmes in sports, arts, and STEM, designed to nurture well-rounded students.

Springdale Primary School focuses on "Be a Better Me!" and actively introduces practices like Whole Body Listening and Mindful Breathing to enhance students' focus, communication, and emotional regulation. The school has a fresh, vibrant physical environment and actively involves students in community service and environmental projects.

St. Andrew's Junior School is an Anglican Church School founded in 1862. It is sited within St. Andrew's Village and is committed to providing an all-round education molded in Christian principles. The school's vision is to nurture servant leaders who bring life to the nations, with a strong emphasis on effective bilingualism and high numeracy skills.

St. Anthony's Canossian Primary School is a government-aided girls' school affiliated with St. Anthony's Canossian Secondary School. The school's educational approach focuses on the Canossian values and holistic development. It offers special support for students with Special Educational Needs (SEN).

St. Anthony's Primary School is a government-aided, co-educational Catholic and Lasallian school, founded in 1879 by the Catholic Portuguese Mission. The school's mission is to be "a caring Lasallian community that nurtures every student to be a person of integrity, and a confident learner". It is affiliated with St. Patrick's School and St. Joseph's Institution (Secondary).

St. Hilda's Primary School is a government-aided, co-educational Anglican school, affiliated with St. Hilda's Secondary School. The school's mission is to provide a balanced development of mind, body, and spirit, nurturing students to be God-fearing citizens. It is a Gifted Education Programme (GEP) Centre and follows its core values of Love, Live, Learn, Serve, and Strive.

St. Margaret's School is the oldest girls' school in Singapore and the Far East, founded in 1842 by Mrs. Maria Dyer. The school is guided by a fine tradition of service to the community. Its mission is the education and nurture of young girls to develop in body, soul, and spirit, growing and glowing for God.

St. Stephen's School is a Catholic and Lasallian government-aided all-boys' school. Its ultimate goal is for each boy to "enter to learn, and leave to serve, especially the last, lost and the least". The school's core values are Faith, Service, and Community, which guide its strong emphasis on character development and servant leadership.

St. Gabriel's Primary School is a government-aided all-boys' Catholic mission school that is part of the Gabrielite family. The school motto is "Labor Omnia Vincit" (Labour conquers all things). It aims to develop young Gabrielites into gentlemen who uphold Christian values and are of service to God and Nation.

St. Joseph's Institution Junior (SJI Junior) is a Catholic, Lasallian boys' primary school, formerly known as St. Michael's School. Its motto is the Latin "Ora et Labora" (Pray and Work), which calls upon students to be guided by God through prayer and to work conscientiously in service to God. It aims to empower students to be "men of integrity and men for others".

Tampines North Primary School's vision is "Future Ready Learners, Responsible Citizens, and Caring Leaders". The school focuses on a positive and proactive approach to discipline, emphasizing building self-discipline, good character, and strong relationships. Its LLP, G4Life, builds character through environmental education.

Tampines Primary School, established in 1985, is committed to the core belief that every pupil can learn and excel. The school adopted the motto "To Persevere and Succeed". It is forward-looking and has an emphasis on the effective use of ICT to support teaching and learning, structuring collaborative learning experiences beyond the classroom.

Tanjong Katong Primary School's mission is to nurture students so that they can excel in their pursuits and contribute to society. Its vision is to develop "Passionate Learners, Caring Leaders, and Global Citizens". The school's core values are encapsulated in the acronym PR2IDE (Perseverance, Respect, Responsibility, Integrity, Discipline, and Empathy).

Tao Nan School, established in 1906, is a government-aided Special Assistance Plan (SAP) school and one of the six Singapore Hokkien Huay Kuan schools. Its motto is "Sincerity and Perseverance". Historically, its original building now houses the Peranakan Museum. The school offers the Gifted Education Programme (GEP) and fosters a strong commitment to bilingualism and Chinese culture.

Teck Ghee Primary School is a government, co-educational school that offers a full range of academic subjects and support for students with Special Educational Needs (SEN). The school focuses on providing a holistic curriculum and is committed to developing well-rounded individuals. Its LLP, "The Art of Communication through Multimedia", emphasizes creative expression and digital literacy.

Teck Whye Primary School's motto is "Aspire and Achieve". Its mission is "To nurture every child to be a confident and creative leader, grounded in moral values and committed to serve the community". The school's core values guide its programmes, which include an ALP focused on developing media literate communicators and an LLP in leadership through service.

Telok Kurau Primary School has a history dating back to 1926 and was attended by Singapore's late former Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew and Malaysia's late former Prime Minister Datuk Hussein Onn. After several mergers and relocations, the school now focuses on a holistic education, utilizing its ALP in Coding and Robotics and its LLP in Character Development through Team Sports.

Temasek Primary School's vision is to be a "Vibrant Learning Campus where students Learn, Lead, Serve and Grow". Its mission is to develop students into responsible and versatile individuals with a passion for life-long learning, guided by the motto "Forward Together". The school's corporate values prioritize Students, People, and Partners.

Townsville Primary School's vision is "A Vibrant School Leaders of Character, Learners for Life". The school will be relocating to East Canberra (Sembawang) tentatively in 2029 and will temporarily cease P1 admissions from 2025 to 2027. The school's core values, iDARE2, emphasize Integrity, Diligence, Aspiration, Respect, Empathy, and Excellence.

Unity Primary School is a government, co-educational school. Its vision is to be a "Gracious Community of Confident Learners and Responsible Citizens". The school's LLP, "CharGE UP!", uses green and experiential learning for character development. The school is committed to nurturing leaders of good standing and character, who are able to apply critical thinking and communication skills.

Valour Primary School is a government, co-educational school. Its vision is to nurture "Leaders of Integrity, Learners of Excellence and Citizens of Compassion". The school’s red "V" in its crest symbolizes staff and students reaching out to the world with passion, courage, and confidence. It focuses on instilling knowledge and values to guide students to lead and serve.

Waterway Primary School is a government, co-educational school committed to fostering "a culture of care and excellence in a caring and enabling environment". The school focuses on providing holistic learning experiences and distinctive programmes to develop its students' potential and pride.

Wellington Primary School, established in 2001, has a vision to be "an excellent institution that grows future-ready leaders". The school empowers students to make responsible decisions based on its RICE² values (Respect, Responsibility, Integrity, Innovation, Care, and Community). It uses a whole-school educative process called the Personal Mastery Board to teach values and develop self-discipline.

West Grove Primary School is a government, co-educational school. Its mission is to be a "Learning Community that Nurtures the Whole Child". The school is committed to developing gracious leaders and emphasizes a culture of care and inclusiveness, offering support for students with special educational needs.

West Spring Primary School's vision is to nurture "Leaders, Learners, and Individuals of Character". The school is committed to providing a conducive environment where every student achieves academic excellence, character excellence, and realizes their potential. It promotes a holistic educational experience through its distinctive ALP and LLP.

West View Primary School is a government, co-educational school in Bukit Panjang. Its mission is to inspire learning, nurture TALENT values, and build strong home-school bonds. The school has a focus on environmental sustainability (ALP) and encourages students to appreciate, create, explore, and excel in the arts (LLP).

Westwood Primary School is a "Positive Education School" dedicated to nurturing thriving teachers and flourishing pupils. The school’s approach focuses on instilling a love for the community and service leadership through positive education principles, helping students grow into confident, independent individuals.

White Sands Primary School was established in 1998 and later merged with Coral Primary School in 2019. The school's motto is "Learn, Grow and Excel Together". This single-session, co-educational school offers an enhanced learning experience, integrating its ALP in Coding and Computational Thinking and its LLP in Visual Arts.

Woodgrove Primary School's motto is "Seizing Opportunities, Aspirations Realised". The school believes that every student can be a successful learner, steadfast leader, stable contributor, and staunch citizen. It is guided by its iGR3ACE values (Integrity, Gratefulness, Respect, Responsibility, Resilience, Adaptability, Courage, and Empathy) to promote holistic development.

Woodlands Primary School is a government, co-educational school with a vision to nurture "Gracious Woodlanders with the Zest to Excel". The school emphasizes innovative pedagogies and play-based learning to foster an engaging and dynamic learning experience. Its ALP, "Joy of Learning Languages", aims to empower students to be confident communicators.

Woodlands Ring Primary School's vision is "Passionate Learners and Gracious Citizens", guided by the motto "We do our best". The school places students at the heart of all its endeavors, providing a vibrant learning environment with diverse programmes to hone skills and apply them in different contexts.

Xinghua Primary School has a long history, founded in 1930 as Sing Hua Public School. The school embodies a resilient spirit, having overcome major setbacks throughout its history. Its motto is "Towards Excellence". It focuses on nurturing students into resilient achievers and thoughtful citizens, with distinctive programmes in Environmental Education (ALP) and Visual Arts (LLP).

Xingnan Primary School's vision is "Xingnanians: Passion to Learn, Will to Overcome, Attitude to Excel and Spirit to Serve". The school believes in providing opportunities for students to excel in areas of interest beyond the classrooms. Its ALP, "IXORA", inspires students to be responsible individuals and advocates of sustainable living. The school's CCAs are central to developing leadership and social skills.

Xinmin Primary School's vision is "Every Xinminite, a confident citizen of character, ready for the future". The school focuses on teaching pupils how to learn, inspiring them to think, and kindling their imagination to enlarge their vision. It provides an environment where every student matters, is unique, and has the ability to reach their fullest potential.

Xishan Primary School is a government, co-educational school that offers support for students with Special Educational Needs (SEN). The school's mission is to be "A Leader, A Learner, A Citizen, Nurturing Xishanites for Life and Future". It emphasizes developing confident leaders through mental skills empowerment and its ALP, NEXUS, focuses on communication and news enrichment.

Yangzheng Primary School's vision is "Every Yangzhengnite - a Passionate Learner, a Caring Friend and a Responsible Citizen". The school is committed to providing a supportive environment to help every student develop their physical, intellectual, emotional, social, and aesthetic capabilities to their fullest potential. Its motto is "From Each His Finest Effort".

Yew Tee Primary School's vision is to nurture "Reflective Learners, Empowered Leaders, Persons of Character". The school focuses on developing adaptable, confident, and reflective learners who are guided by values such as Integrity, Responsibility, Respect, Perseverance, and Care. The ALP, D.R.E.A.M., aims to develop creative minds through reflection and empowerment.

Yio Chu Kang Primary School is a government, co-educational school that provides a well-rounded education. The school aims to provide a safe, disciplined, and enriching learning environment. Its distinctive programmes include an ALP in Environmental STEM-based applied learning and an LLP focused on the arts, media, and design.

Yishun Primary School believes every child can learn and grow through a holistic education in a caring and nurturing environment. The school is committed to nurturing leaders of character guided by values such as Gratitude, Care, and Resilience. It places great emphasis on empowering students with a Growth Mindset to view challenges as opportunities for growth.

Yu Neng Primary School, founded in 1935 as Yeu Nerng School, is a government, co-educational school. Its core philosophy revolves around values-driven bilingualism and an inclusive approach. The school’s ALP in Digital Making and Tech4Good integrates technology with real-world applications to foster innovation and problem-solving.

Yuhua Primary School is a government, co-educational school. Its mission is to "Grow Our Hearts and Minds", focusing on building good character and nurturing a passion for learning. Its vision is for every student to "Care, Share and Contribute; Learn, Think and Innovate". The school's ALP, "Think@Yuhua", is interdisciplinary, and its LLP uses music and the performing arts for character development.

Yumin Primary School has its roots in two Chinese village schools from the 1940s that merged and were later renamed. Its vision is to nurture "Flourishing Champions, Future-Ready Learners, Gracious Citizens". The school's mission is to enable students to experience the joy of learning and challenge their minds to develop their fullest potential.

Zhangde Primary School's vision is a "Learning School With A GIVER3S Heart", guided by a mission to nurture thinking individuals and gracious citizens. The school places a strong emphasis on Environment Education (ALP) and provides themed gardens for rich, authentic learning. Its LLP uses adventure and sports to instil resilience and collaboration.

Zhenghua Primary School is a government, co-educational school that believes every child is special and talented. Its vision is to nurture "Leaders of Character, Critical and Creative Thinkers, Lifelong Learners". The school focuses on a whole-child approach, emphasizing moral, aesthetic, physical, intellectual, emotional, and social capacity.

Zhonghua Primary School's history is tied to Chung Hwa Girls' School, the first Chinese-medium girls' school in Singapore, founded in 1911. Its motto is "Diligence Before Success". The school’s mission is to "Ignite Passion For Learning, Nurture Strength of Character", aiming to develop students who are learners, thinkers, and leaders.
